title: Satsuki Shō
text:
The is a Japanese <a href="Conditions%20races">Grade 1</a> <a href="Flat%20racing">flat</a> <a href="Horse%20racing">horse race</a> in <a href="Japan">Japan</a> for three-year-old <a href="thoroughbred">thoroughbred</a> <a href="Colt%20%28horse%29">colts</a> and <a href="Filly">fillies</a> run over a distance of 2,000 metres (approximately mile) at the <a href="Nakayama%20Racecourse">Nakayama Racecourse</a>, <a href="Funabashi%2C%20Chiba">Funabashi, Chiba</a>, in April.
It was first run in 1939 and is the Japanese equivalent of the English <a href="2%2C000%20Guineas%20Stakes">2,000 Guineas</a>. (Note that the original 2,000 Guineas is currently run at 1,609 metres, or one mile, about two furlongs shorter than the Satsuki Shō.)
Winners since 1990.
 The 2011 race took place at <a href="Tokyo%20Racecourse">Tokyo Racecourse</a> due to the <a href="2011%20Tohoku%20earthquake%20and%20tsunami">2011 Tohoku earthquake and tsunami</a>.
